meanings.definition: Modest or shy because of a lack of self-confidence.
meanings.sent1: She felt diffident about speaking in front of the class.
meanings.sent2: The diffident student quietly sat at the back of the room.
meanings.sent3: Despite her diffident nature, she surprised everyone with her confident dance moves.
meanings.sent4: His diffident demeanor masked a hidden talent for public speaking.
meanings.sent5: The diffident kitten cautiously approached the unfamiliar toy.

meanings.definition: Showing a lack of confidence in one's own abilities.
meanings.sent1: The diffident singer hesitated before starting her performance.
meanings.sent2: He was diffident about taking on the leadership role.
meanings.sent3: The diffident chef nervously presented his signature dish to the judges.
meanings.sent4: Her diffident attitude held her back from pursuing her dreams.
meanings.sent5: The diffident driver hesitated at the intersection, unsure of which way to turn.
